alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 1:55PM EDT until August 12 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Warren County in north central Pennsylvania... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 154 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Youngsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Youngsville, Warren South, Kinzua Dam, Chapman State Park, Ludlow, Tidioute, Starbrick and Clarendon. Radar has indicated rotation within this severe thunderstorm. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, tornadoes can develop quickly during severe thunderstorms. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Stay inside a well built structure and keep away from windows. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, they can develop quickly during severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. This severe thunderstorm may cause serious injury and significant property damage. This thunderstorm is capable of producing all types of severe weather including extremely large hail, destructive straight line winds and tornadoes. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central Pennsylvania.
